00020 #ifndef AFFX_FILEIO_H
00021 #define AFFX_FILEIO_H 1

00026 //

00030 #include "portability/affy-base-types.h"
00031 
00032 // Affy uses little-endian byte order for some of their files.
00033 // This requires defining a the complements to the normal functions "hton".
00034 
00035 // These functions are intended to be used in conjunction with
00036 // the writer functions in FileWriter.h.  The general format of the
00037 // function names is: {Read,Write}{UInt,Int,Float}{8,16,32}{N,I}
00038 
00043 inline uint32_t
00044 affy_swap32(uint32_t x) {
00045   return ((((x) & 0xff000000) >> 24) | (((x) & 0x00ff0000) >>  8) |
00046           (((x) & 0x0000ff00) <<  8) | (((x) & 0x000000ff) << 24));
00047 }
00048 
00053 inline uint16_t
00054 affy_swap16(uint16_t x) {
00055   return ((((x) >> 8) & 0xff) | (((x) & 0xff) << 8));
00056 }
00057 
00058 // Do we need to define our "to little-endian" operators?
00059 #if BYTE_ORDER == BIG_ENDIAN
00060 
00062 #define htoil(x) affy_swap32(x)
00063 
00065 #define htois(x) affy_swap16(x)
00066 
00068 #define itohl(x) affy_swap32(x)
00069 
00071 #define itohs(x) affy_swap16(x)
00072 
00073 #else // the machine is little-endian
00074 
00076 #define htoil(x) (x)
00077 
00079 #define htois(x) (x)
00080 
00082 #define itohl(x) (x)
00083 
00085 #define itohs(x) (x)
00086 
00087 #endif
00088
